Name: Bomb Squad
Powers: AP 4 - Reduce block rolls by 4. Insane - Dies after combat.

Name: Beserkers
Powers: Random mover - Roll a die for movement and charging. 1-2 -> 1 space 3-4 -> 2 spaces 5-6 -> 3 spaces You must move the full distance, or collide with something. If the unit moves off the board, it is lost. Maneouverable - May turn once at any point during a move or charge

Name: Wolf Chariots
Powers: Impact Hits d3 - If you get a charge bonus, do d3 attacks per model hitting on 4+. These count towards who won combat.

Name: Bangwagons
Powers: Insane - Dies after combat. Powder Keg - d6 attacks per model AP 4 - Reduce block rolls by 4. Fast Charger - Rolls two charge bonus die, so it can travel up to two extra squares on the charge.

Name: Starchucker
Powers: War Machine - Dies if it flees. Can't move into combat. Razorstar - Ranged weapon. Range d6 (per model). For each shot, the first unit in that range gets one attack that hits on 3+, AP -3, and does 3 wounds. If it hits, the next unit takes a 4+, AP -2, 2 wound attack. If that hits, the third unit takes a 5+, AP -1, 1 wound attack. This shot can't pass through terrain. Friendly Fire - Can shoot into combat and into friendly units.

Name: Boombox
Powers: War Machine - Dies if it flees. Can't move into combat. The Big Guns - Pick a target square within 6. Roll a die for each model in this unit. 6 - Direct hit. 5 - Off by one, your choice. 4 - Off by one, towards the opponents board edge. 3 - Off by one, towards your board edge. 2 - Off by two, opponent's choice where. 1 - Hit yourself. The central tile takes d6 attacks, 3+ AP -1. The four adjacent tiles take 1 hit each, 4+ AP0. Friendly Fire - Can shoot into combat and into friendly units.

Name: Flagellants
Powers: Unbreakable - Can't flee Rabid - Must charge if able to

Name: Tincans
Powers: Stalwart - Add 1 to leadership rolls Slow - Don't roll a bonus charge dice

Name: Skitterers
Powers: Maneouverable - May turn once at any point during a move or charge

Name: Ninjas
Powers: Elusive 1 - All to-hit rolls targetting this unit suffer a -1 penalty. Smoke Bombs - Once per game before combat, move this unit forward 2. This can go through any unit but must end in an unoccupied space. This can bring the unit into a new combat.

Name: Heavies
Powers: Stalwart - Add 1 to leadership rolls

Name: Swarmaltar
Powers: Call the Swarm - Free action: Revive d6 rats in a common unit. If you have two Swarmaltars select up to two different units. Limited to the starting number of rats.

Name: Feastaltar
Powers: Aura of Power - Adjacent rats gain +1 to hit in melee

Name: Chumpwagon
Powers: Trojan Rats - When this unit is wiped out, place a unit of Ratkin Warriors (same level as this) either in the same cell, or one of the four adjacent cells. You choose which direction they are facing.

Name: Battering-Rat
Powers: Impact Hits d6+1 - If you get a charge bonus, do d6+1 attacks per model hitting on a 4+. These count towards who won combat. Push - If you charge an opponent one square away with an empty space behind them, they are pushed. Move them back one and move into their original square. This can't push opponents off the board. This counts for charge distance.

Name: Warriors
Powers: Poison - 6s to hit can't be saved

Name: Webspitters
Powers: Poison - 6s to hit can't be saved Spit Webs - Opponents that start a combat with this unit gain strikes last for the turn.

Name: Trappers
Powers: Poison - 6s to hit can't be saved Web Sacs - Enemies can't use evasion against this unit

Name: Huntsmen
Powers: Poison - 6s to hit can't be saved Flexible - Turn to face any direction at the start of your turn

Name: Jumpers
Powers: Poison - 6s to hit can't be saved Tactical Retreat - Can choose to flee before combat starts Jumping - Can jump over units while moving and charging. Must end their turn in an empty square.

Name: Widowmakers
Powers: Poison - 6s to hit can't be saved Maneouverable - May turn once at any point during a move or charge Virulent - Any unit wounded by this unit becomes Poisoned. At the start of each of the controlling players turns, Poisoned units take a wound on a 4+ with no armour saves allowed.

Name: Shimmerwebs
Powers: Poison - 6s to hit can't be saved Evasive - Enemy attacks only hit this unit on 6s.

Name: Webdancers
Powers: Poison - 6s to hit can't be saved Shifting - When this unit is revealed, you may immediately move it to any empty adjacent square. This can be used before combat starts. Flexible - Turn to face any direction at the start of your turn

Name: Cocoon Cannon
Powers: War Machine - Dies if it flees. Can't move into combat. Poison - 6s to hit can't be saved Cocoon Cannon - Pick a target square within 6. Roll a die for each model in this unit. 5 or 6 - Direct hit 4 - Off by one, your choice 2 or 3 - Miss 1 - Off by one, opponent's choice The target tile takes 3 attacks hitting on 4+ with poison. The unit may not move on its next turn.

Name: Spitter
Powers: War Machine - Dies if it flees. Can't move into combat. Poison - 6s to hit can't be saved Virulent - Any unit wounded by this unit becomes Poisoned. At the start of each of the controlling players turns, Poisoned units take a wound on a 4+ with no armour saves allowed. Spitter Cannon - Ranged weapon. Range 5. Each model fires 4 shots. Can shoot over friendly units.

Name: Warriors
Powers: Unstable - Instead of rolling to flee, lose extra wounds for every point you lost combat.

Name: Archers
Powers: Unstable - Instead of rolling to flee, lose extra wounds for every point you lost combat.

Name: Revenants
Powers: Unstable - Instead of rolling to flee, lose extra wounds for every point you lost combat. Revenants - After combat, add a new model for each enemy that died. Limited to the starting size.

Name: Wights
Powers: Unstable - Instead of rolling to flee, lose extra wounds for every point you lost combat. Terrifying - At the start of each round of combat, all enemy units in combat with it must roll to flee. If they flee out of combat, no combat takes place.

Name: Skullclops
Powers: Unstable - Instead of rolling to flee, lose extra wounds for every point you lost combat. Mighty Cleave - In combat this unit makes its attacks against all adjacent enemy units. Roll separately for each. Natural Warrior - Equipment costs 1 less.

Name: Grave Beast
Powers: Unstable - Instead of rolling to flee, lose extra wounds for every point you lost combat. Revenants - After combat, add a new wound for each enemy that died. Can resurrect models. Limited to the starting size. Terrifying - At the start of each round of combat, all enemy units in combat with it must roll to flee. If they flee out of combat, no combat takes place.

Name: Necromancers
Powers: Unstable - Instead of rolling to flee, lose extra wounds for every point you lost combat. Raise the Dead 1 - Free action: Choose an undead unit and heal 1 wound per Necromancer. This can resurrect models. Limited to the starting number of units/wounds.

Name: Terrormancers
Powers: Unstable - Instead of rolling to flee, lose extra wounds for every point you lost combat. Bone Spurs - Ranged weapon. Can target any unit adjacent to a friendly Boneborn unit. Can fire into combat. Wounded units by this attack must immediately roll to flee.

Name: Wall of Flesh
Powers: Unstable - Instead of rolling to flee, lose extra wounds for every point you lost combat. Spongey 2 - Ignore 2 damage every round of combat or when hit by a ranged attack. Slow - Don't roll a bonus charge dice

Name: Ghouls
Powers: Unstable - Instead of rolling to flee, lose extra wounds for every point you lost combat. Revenants - After combat, add a new revenant for each enemy that died. Limited to the starting size. Fast Charger - Rolls two charge bonus die, so it can travel up to two extra squares on the charge.

Name: Fodder
Powers: Unstable - Instead of rolling to flee, lose extra wounds for every point you lost combat.

Unstable - Instead of rolling to flee, lose extra wounds for every point you lost combat. Corpse Explosion - Pick an enemy unit in combat. After combat has been resolved this turn, the unit suffers a ranged hit for each unit (friendly and enemy) that died in the combat, hitting on 4+.
Unstable - Instead of rolling to flee, lose extra wounds for every point you lost combat.
Unstable - Instead of rolling to flee, lose extra wounds for every point you lost combat.

Unstable - Instead of rolling to flee, lose extra wounds for every point you lost combat. Perpetual - After the unit is wiped out, leave their card face down. At the start of each turn, if the space is unoccupied you may roll a die. On a 4+, bring the unit back to life with full wounds, facing a direction of your choice Slow - Don't roll a bonus charge dice
